metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15862 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Net-SNMP through 5.8 has Improper Privilege Management because SNMP WRITEaccess to the EXTEND MIB provides the ability to run arbitrary commands asroot.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15862` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsnmp-base - 5.8+dfsg-2ubuntu2.3
libsnmp-perl - 5.8+dfsg-2ubuntu2.3
libsnmp35 - 5.8+dfsg-2ubuntu2.3
snmp - 5.8+dfsg-2ubuntu2.3
snmpd - 5.8+dfsg-2ubuntu2.3
snmptrapd - 5.8+dfsg-2ubuntu2.3
tkmib - 5.8+dfsg-2ubuntu2.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: net-snmp package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.8+dfsg-2ubuntu2.3').
